text:
The main missing feature is some kind of “background” or “history” of a story. This app does an incredible job summarizing and effectively condensing a current story from different angles, but what would make it amazing is the ability to pull in older articles (or even just content from the Wikipedia article on the topic if there is one) about this story for context. Most times, a news story is just the latest in a whole series of related events, but this app only pulls from that newest event and doesn’t make it easy at all to see context of what led up to this event. 

If you could add something that adds that historical related event context, it would be a game changer because no news outlet does this well.  image _thanke_ • _1.1.6 (1)_ • _AppStore_ • _18.4_ • _iPhone_, with interactive elements

text:
Feedback for Particle App:

I really enjoy using Particle! One of my favorite things about the app is how it presents article information in an easy-to-read format. I especially appreciate the different reading options like the “5 Ws” and “Explain Like I’m 5” — they make consuming news more approachable and engaging.

However, the user interface could use some improvement. It can feel a bit overwhelming at times, as the app tends to bombard you with a lot of information all at once. A cleaner, more organized, or minimalistic design would definitely take the experience to a 5/5 for me.

Overall, I genuinely enjoy the app and can see myself using it more in the future! image _nobu_ • _1.1.6 (1)_ • _AppStore_ • _18.4_ • _iPhone_, with interactive elements

text.text:
Feedback for Particle App:

I really enjoy using Particle! One of my favorite things about the app is how it presents article information in an easy-to-read format. I especially appreciate the different reading options like the “5 Ws” and “Explain Like I’m 5” — they make consuming news more approachable and engaging.

However, the user interface could use some improvement. It can feel a bit overwhelming at times, as the app tends to bombard you with a lot of information all at once. A cleaner, more organized, or minimalistic design would definitely take the experience to a 5/5 for me.

Overall, I genuinely enjoy the app and can see myself using it more in the future!

He entered the country illegally and was *denied* asylum in US court in 2019.

Request: Isn’t it misleading to state that the U.S. Supreme Court’s orders are being ‘defied’ in this case, given that the Court ordered U.S. compliance with El Salvador, and it is El Salvador—not the U.S.—that has chosen not to return Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who illegally entered the U.S. in 2011?
Response: The U.S. is criticized for insufficient efforts to comply with the Supreme Court’s order to ‘facilitate’ Abrego Garcia’s return.

text:
This answer fails to include critical contextual information about the circumstances surrounding Abrego Garcia’s arrival in the US, as well as the role of US immigration policy in preventing others like him from obtaining legal recognition as asylum seekers, residents, citizens, etc.  Abrego was sent here by his family when he was just 16 years old. By definition, he couldn’t have made the choice to cross the US-Mx border illegally. He was too young at the time - at least according to US law - to live on his own without a parent or guardian, let alone undertake a project like traveling from El Salvador through Mexico, into Texas, and then onto Maryland independently. Of note, his status as a minor child barred him from making other independent decisions - including, say, obtaining legal representation to pursue an asylum case - after he arrived. While some might want to argue that he should have hired an attorney the moment he turned 18, I respectfully ask that they take an afternoon to research the options he had available to him at that time and then ask themselves what they would have done differently- or expected their 18-year-old son to do - under similar circumstances. Without these additions, this answer is harmful.  *Feedback provided on question*:
Request: Did Garcia come to the us leagally?
Response: No, Garcia entered the U.S. illegally.

I just want to mention two significant issue i faced while using your app. 1st issue i faced was heating issue on my iPhone 15 (256GB, iOS 18.4) I felt a significant warmth while holding the phone and i used the app for mere reading and normally navigating news (approx 15mins). Secondly, i encountered a stutter. After using the app for 15-18 mins, while reading an article it got freeze in between nothing was working for like 10 secs i tried closing the app and restarting it again but nothing worked i waited a bit longer then it started functioning normally. I encountered these issues 3-4 times so i thought to let the team know about it. Im looking forward for an update if necessary to resolve these issues. Please look into this.

Thanks & Regards. image _samant_ • _1.1.8 (1)_ • _AppStore_ • _18.4_ • _iPhone_, with interactive elements

Truly amazing and good stuff. Secondly, i encountered a stutter. After using the app for 15-18 mins, while reading an article it got freeze in between nothing was working for like 10 secs i tried closing the app and restarting it again but nothing worked i waited a bit longer then it started functioning normally. I encountered these issues 3-4 times so i thought to let the team know about it. Im looking forward for an update if necessary to resolve these issues. Please look into this.

Thanks & Regards.

text:
Hi, I believe a simple 1 dimensional political spectrum is not entirely informative to a reader. It tends to cause a reader to pick a side subjectively. More degrees of freedom (liberal-authoritarian), (progressive-traditionalist) would likely reduce this, but including that information at all will always introduce a high level of bias and subjectivity in a readers opinion. I like that you do state identify how various media outlets tend to spin things, this does promote more objectivity and still leaves the reader to make their opinion without as much bias as the spectrum.  *Feedback provided on cluster*:

text: Hi.  While I like the ‘Explore’ feature, are you aware the icon you use is actually the Unicode/ISO standard icon for the Dharmachakra, a sacred Buddist and Hindu symbol?  I know it looks kinda like a wheel from a pirate ship so I get why it’s being used, but you might want to pick something a little less on the nose. A map, or compass? image _darklight_ • _1.1.10 (2)_ • _AppStore_ • _18.5_ • _iPhone_ 🇬🇧, with interactive elements

text: When you tap into a story, the subheading should be displayed under the heading rather than having to be selected amongst the Summary, etc options. Normally when I’m reading news, I’ve read half the subheading before I decide to tap or click to read something in more detail and it’s very jarring the subheading disappears when I tap, requiring me to swipe out of the story to finishing reading the subheading. image _lint_ • _1.1.9 (4)_ • _AppStore_ • _18.5_ • _iPhone_ 🇦🇺, with interactive elements

text: I absolutely love your app, very concise, and the frontend is done really well. I have seen that you guys want to share the world news with shorter words and make us users up to date! And for that to happen, the most recent news have to be on the feed on time. I’ve been noticing that when I share news to my peers, they tell me that it’s literally yesterday’s news! Then I check the timing on the least recent article used and it says 15–19 hours so it is true, but when I see the card itself, it says 2 Hours Ago. I wish I could use the app for the most recent news efficiently so I could be up to date. Thank you again for the wonderful app. image _asusbit_ • _1.1.10 (2)_ • _AppStore_ • _18.5_ • _iPhone_ 🇴🇲, with interactive elements

text:
This is a game changing application. Unfortunately, it didn’t appear to reliably pull from smaller sources. As a person into mostly fringe media like gaming, mma, technology, and indie films—it seems line I only have a handful of “stories” to read on particle. Whereas my RSS setup has hundreds of articles a day—most of which Particle has no idea about. 

Seems like it’s more for actual big media journalism and such, which is cool, but that really excludes a massive chunk of the internet. I want the news that matters to me, not what you think matters to me. Could Particle potentially add some rss ingestion which then applies its magic to the hundreds of stories and turn them into dozens? 

Love the app. I’m just regularly running out of stuff for it to suggest to me and having to track it down manually through the explore and search sections. There’s more in there that I want—it just isn’t being offered to me. This is after extensive training of topics I am interested in. 

Thanks! image _lukasskott_ • _1.1.11 (2)_ • _AppStore_ • _19.0_ • _iPhone_ 🇺🇸, with interactive elements

text:
상호작용 요소가 있는 Dear Developer of Particle,
I am one of your big fan so i just wanted to take a moment to thank you for creating such an incredible AI app that has transformed the way I read and process articles and news.This AI has been an invaluable tool in my daily routine, making me more efficient and enhancing my understanding of various topics. I am now studying pharmacology at univ in Korea and nearly read nothing all day for, I’ve been quite busy with exams:( one day, I saw a reels introducing your app so I gave a try which turned out to be awesome!!  Best feature I particularly appreciate is the related articles and following bottons, which allows me to get to know more about the content Im interested in and get instant, accurate summaries. This has saved me a tremendous amount of time, especially when dealing with complex or lengthy articles.
Your app has not only made staying informed easier but has also made the process more enjoyable. I’m truly grateful for the hard work and innovation that went into developing such an app! 👍
The user-friendly interface and the option to organize my library into collections make it feel like a personal assistant tailored just for me. I’ve recommended AI to several friends and they’ve all been impressed by its capabilities.
The question popped up my head that how does this app earn fortunes for the developers? This service is completely free and I don’t particularly see ads (for my type at least) i sincerely hope this app one day costs a heavy fee as gpt or perplexity ;( and I also want to know is there any stock related with your app that I could own cause I strongly believe this service will one day skyrocket and that would come very soon.
Thank you again for your dedication to creating such a helpful tool. It’s clear that a lot of thought and effort went into making it as effective and user-friendly as possible.
Best regards, -yong- image _agon_drpharma_ • _1.1.11 (2)_ • _AppStore_ • _18.5_ • _iPhone_ 🇰🇷

text.text:
Dear Developer of Particle,
I am one of your big fan so i just wanted to take a moment to thank you for creating such an incredible AI app that has transformed the way I read and process articles and news.This AI has been an invaluable tool in my daily routine, making me more efficient and enhancing my understanding of various topics. I am now studying pharmacology at univ in Korea and nearly read nothing all day for, I’ve been quite busy with exams:( one day, I saw a reels introducing your app so I gave a try which turned out to be awesome!!  Best feature I particularly appreciate is the related articles and following bottons, which allows me to get to know more about the content Im interested in and get instant, accurate summaries. This has saved me a tremendous amount of time, especially when dealing with complex or lengthy articles.
Your app has not only made staying informed easier but has also made the process more enjoyable. I’m truly grateful for the hard work and innovation that went into developing such an app! :+1:
The user-friendly interface and the option to organize my library into collections make it feel like a personal assistant tailored just for me. I’ve recommended AI to several friends and they’ve all been impressed by its capabilities.
The question popped up my head that how does this app earn fortunes for the developers? This service is completely free and I don’t particularly see ads (for my type at least) i sincerely hope this app one day costs a heavy fee as gpt or perplexity ;( and I also want to know is there any stock related with your app that I could own cause I strongly believe this service will one day skyrocket and that would come very soon.
Thank you again for your dedication to creating such a helpful tool. It’s clear that a lot of thought and effort went into making it as effective and user-friendly as possible.
Best regards, -yong-
